content: You can do more than you think. We are tied down by invisible orthodoxy. The laws of physics are the only limit.
We know less than we think. The replication crisis is not an aberration. Many of the things we believe are wrong. We are often not even asking the right questions.

It's important to do things fast. You learn more per unit time because you make contact with reality more frequently. Going fast makes you focus on what's important; there's no time for bullshit. Slow is fake. A week is 2% of the year. Time is the denominator
Enthusiasm matters! It's much easier to work on things that are exciting to you. It might be easier to do big things than small things for this reason. Energy is a necessary input for progress

As human beings it is our right (maybe our moral duty) to reshape the universe to our preferences: Technology which is really knowledge enables this; You should probably work on raising the ceiling not the floor
